TextBlock.Text: HYACINTH: Well, I ran out of recorders, so I have to imbue the rest of my information on a scroll.

HYACINTH: So, I found a fire that isn't surrounded by others, and I slept with the device in my hand. I woke up with it lit in my hand and without my suit! (Hopefully I can prevent the latter in the future.)
HYACINTH: Anyways, that confirms my hypothesis, although, the nature of this place still confuses me.
HYACINTH: I will be departing soon, I think I have seen enough for now. Perhaps later I can improvise on this technology, after I am finished visiting the Quantum Moon.
HYACINTH: They said something about the North Pole, right?
HYACINTH: I can't tell if this would be seen as a grand discovery or sacrelige, best to keep this knowledge to myself for now.
HYACINTH: Then again, I don't think my liberal usage of recorders is doing the whole secrecy plan any favors.
